Instance.description: A construct that applies certain effects on Sims within a certain geometric constraint.

TunableVariant.name: allow_objects
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, then in addition to all instantiated Sims, some objects will be affected by this broadcaster. Some tuned effects might still only apply to Sims (e.g. affordance pushing).
Setting this tuning field has serious performance repercussions. Its indiscriminate use could undermine our ability to meet Minspec goals. Please use this sparingly.

TunableTuple.name: disallow
TunableTuple.description: Allow no objects, other than Sims, to be affected by this broadcaster.

TunableTuple.name: from_flammable
TunableTuple.description: Allow objects to be affected by this broadcaster if they are flammable.

TunableTuple.name: from_tags
TunableTuple.description: Allow objects to be affected by this broadcaster based on tags.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: An object with any tag in this set can be affected by the broadcaster.

TunableVariant.name: allow_sim_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows for a top level test set to determine which sims can be affected by the broadcaster at all.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

Tunable.name: allow_sims
Tunable.description:
If checked then this broadcaster will consider Sims. This is on by default.
If neither allow_objects or allow_sims is checked that will result in a tuning error.

TunableEnum.name: clock_type
TunableEnum.description:
Denotes whether broadcasters of this type are managed in real time or game time.
Most broadcasters should be managed in Game Time because they will update with the speed of the game, including performance dips, and speed changes. However, Real Time broadcasters are more performant because they will only update based on the frequency of real time. You should use real time updates if the broadcaster is enabled for the lifetime of the object, there are a lot of that type, or timing doesn't matter as much.
One Shot Interaction broadcasters should always be Game Time. Environment Score broadcasters should be in Real Time. Consult an engineer if you have questions.

TunableVariant.name: clustering
TunableVariant.description:
If set, then similar broadcasters, i.e. broadcasters of the same instance, will be clustered together if their broadcasting objects are close by. This improves performance and avoids having Sims react multiple times to similar broadcasters. When broadcasters are clustered together, there is no guarantee as to what object will be used for testing purposes.
e.g. Stinky food reactions are clustered together. A test on the broadcaster should not, for example, differentiate between a stinky lobster and a stinky steak, because the broadcasting object is arbitrary and undefined.
e.g. Jealousy reactions are not clustered together. A test on the broadcaster considers the relationship between two Sims. Therefore, it would be unwise to consider an arbitrary Sim if two jealousy broadcasters are close to each other.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Specify how clusters for this particular broadcaster are formed.

Tunable.name: density_epsilon
Tunable.description: A constant that defines whether or not two objects are reachable.

TunableVariant.name: facing_angle
TunableVariant.description: If set, then objects in a cluster must satisfy facing requirements.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: An angle that defines the facing requirements for the purposes of clustering and centroid facing.

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight_constraint
TunableTuple.description: The line of sight parameters for generated clusters.

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

Tunable.name: radius_buffer
Tunable.description: An additional distance (in meters) that will be added to the radius of a cluster. The size of a cluster is based on the objects in it. We need to add an additional amount to ensure that the object is included in the (non-exact) circle constraint.

TunableList.name: constraints
TunableList.description: A list of constraints that define the area of influence of this broadcaster. It is required that at least one constraint be defined.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: The relative circle geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: The relative cone geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: facing
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that requires the sim to face the object.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that creates a line of sight constraint.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_los
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a Line of Sight component will be temporarily created when constraints are needed. This should be used if the affordance requires LOS on an object that doesn't have an LOS component (i.e. a Sim needs to see another Sim WooHoo to play the jealousy reactions but Sims don't have LoS components.)

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TunableTuple.name: ocean_loc
TunableTuple.description: The circle geometry relative to the nearest ocean locator.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Select the depth for the Sim based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

TunableTuple.name: portal
TunableTuple.description: A constraint that is relative to the location of a portal.

TunableList.name: portals
TunableList.description: List of portal data to be used in this constraint.

TunableVariant.name: portal_direction
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the There and Back of the portal. This will not work properly if the portal is missing a Back and Back is specified here.

TunableVariant.name: portal_location
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the entry and exit of a portal direction.

Tunable.name: portal_type
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of portal to use for the constraint.

Tunable.name: require_position_los
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the portal location for a Position constraint. Positions where a Sim can't see the portal (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid. This value won't be used for any tuned sub constraints.

TunableVariant.name: sub_constraint
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify a specific type of constraint to create at the location of the portal.
If disabled then the constraint will just be a location constraint at the location of the portal.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The types of constraints that can be created at the location of the portal.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint that is created at the location of the portal.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: A cone constraint that is created at the location of the portal.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: sub_constraint_offset
TunableTuple.description: Translation offset applied to the sub constraint, relative to the target object.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: position
TunableTuple.description: The relative position geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: relative_circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint whose size is dependent on the size of the target object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

TunableVariant.name: maximum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no larger that the specified amount.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The constraint's maximum radius.

TunableVariant.name: minimum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no smaller than the specified amount.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The constraint's minimum radius.

TunableVariant.name: relative_ideal_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an ideal radius relative to the constraint's radius.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Ideal radius data.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's relative ideal radius. A value of 1 would mean the ideal location is on the outskirt of the constraint; values towards 0 approach the constraint's center.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also scores to 1 instead of starting to fall off to 0 in scoring. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, any goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will all score optimially.

Tunable.name: relative_radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's radius relative to the size of the object. This is a simple multiplier applied to the area generated by the object's footprint

TunableVariant.name: backup_tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents primary spawn points with backup secondary ones.

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableVariant.description: Tags that specify the primary spawnpoints or where to get them.

TunableTuple.name: tags
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified straight out.

TunableTuple.name: university_based
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified right here (on a per university basis)

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_career_si
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the associated career interaction for a university course.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_participant
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified participant holding the id of a university course.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the career ID will be obtained. Typically should be PickedItemId if this interaction comes via a CareerPickerSuperInteraction.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_reference
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified university course slot.

Tunable.name: _course_slot
Tunable.description: Course slot from which to pull the spawn point tags.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id_for_backup
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot if we fall back to the backup tags.

TunableTuple.name: terrain_material
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the terrain materials required.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableList.name: effects
TunableList.description: A list of effects that are applied to Sims and objects affected by this broadcaster.

TunableTuple.name: affordance
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect that pushes an interaction on a Sim that is being affected.

Tunable.name: actor_can_violate_privacy_from_owning_interaction
Tunable.display: Actor Can Violate Privacy From Owning Interaction
Tunable.description: If enabled, the actor of the pushed affordance will be allowed to violate the privacy region from the owning interaction. If disabled, the actor of the pushed affordance will not be able to violate the privacy region created by the owning interaction.

TunableVariant.name: affected_object_cap
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the maximum number of objects that can be affected by this particular effect, per broadcaster. This is a soft- cap, since the data does not persist across multiple broadcaster requests nor save games.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum number of objects that can be affected by this broadcaster.

Tunable.name: affordance_must_run_next
Tunable.description: If set, the affordance will be inserted at the beginning of the Sim's queue.

TunableEnum.name: affordance_priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority at which the specified affordance is to be pushed.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_run_priority
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the priority at which the affordance runs. This may be different than 'affordance_priority'. For example. you might want an affordance to push at high priority such that it cancels existing interactions, but it runs at a lower priority such that it can be more easily canceled.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The run priority for the specified affordance.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: A list of affordances to choose from to push as a result of the broadcaster.

TunableTuple.description: A tuple of affordance to push and weight for how likely the affordance is to be picked.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on Sims affected by the broadcaster.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: How likely this affordance is to be picked.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect that adds a buff while an object is being affected.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: The buff to apply while the broadcaster actively affects the Sim.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

Tunable.name: remove_buff
Tunable.description: If enabled, the buff is automatically cleared on broadcaster ends. If disabled, the buff will remain.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: loot
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect to apply loot to the Sim reacting to the broadcaster.

TunableVariant.name: affected_object_cap
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the maximum number of objects that can be affected by this particular effect, per broadcaster. This is a soft- cap, since the data does not persist across multiple broadcaster requests nor save games.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum number of objects that can be affected by this broadcaster.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: self_buff
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect which gives a buff to the broadcasting object if the number of objects within the broadcaster is inside an interval.

TunableTuple.name: broadcastee_count_interval
TunableTuple.description: If the number of objects within this broadcaster is in this interval, the buff will be applied. Includes lower and upper.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: The buff to apply

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: self_loot
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect which gives loot to the broadcasting object upon the broadcaster stopping, if the number of objects found in the broadcaster duration is inside an interval.

Tunable.name: apply_loot_on_remove
Tunable.description: If enabled, determine whether or not we want to apply this broadcaster's loot when the broadcaster is removed. True means we will apply the loot on removal of the broadcaster False means we will apply the loot as soon as enough sims enter the constraint

TunableTuple.name: broadcastee_count_interval
TunableTuple.description: If the number of objects within this broadcaster is in this interval, loot will be awarded. Includes lower and upper.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: self_state_change
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect that changes the state of the controlling object when first object enters and last object leaves

Tunable.name: enter_state_value
Tunable.description: The state value to enter when first object gets close.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

Tunable.name: exit_state_value
Tunable.description: The state value to enter when last object leaves.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: start_fire
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect to start a fire at the location of the object reacting to the broadcaster

TunableVariant.name: affected_object_cap
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the maximum number of objects that can be affected by this particular effect, per broadcaster. This is a soft- cap, since the data does not persist across multiple broadcaster requests nor save games.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The maximum number of objects that can be affected by this broadcaster.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

Tunable.name: percent_chance
Tunable.description: A value between 0 - 100 which represents the percent chance to start a fire when reacting to the broadcaster.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: state
TunableTuple.description:
A broadcaster effect that applies a state change, from a list of states, for the duration of the object being affected.
If multiple state values are tuned in the list, they will be randomized. Also, each pulse of the broadcaster will re-randomize the state applied to the affected object.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

TunableList.name: state_change_on_enter
TunableList.description: A list of states to randomize between every time an object enters the broadcaster, or the broadcaster pulses.

Tunable.description: A state value to randomly consider setting on objects that enter this broadcaster.

Tunable.name: state_change_on_exit
Tunable.description: The state change to apply the the object stops being affected.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_modifier
TunableTuple.description: A broadcaster effect that starts a statistic modifier on an object.

TunableVariant.name: excluded_participants
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these participants will be excluded from this broadcaster effect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of Participants that will be excluded from having this effect applied to them. If the broadcaster comes from an interaction, these participants will come from that interaction.

Tunable.name: modifier
Tunable.description: The modifier to apply to the tuned statistic.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic to be affected by the modifier.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must pass in order for the broadcaster effect to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: frequency
TunableVariant.description: Define in what instances and how often this broadcaster affects Sims and objects in its area of influence.

TunableTuple.name: on_enter
TunableTuple.description: Sims and objects are affected by this broadcaster when they enter in its area of influence, or when the broadcaster is created.

Tunable.name: allow_multiple
Tunable.description: If checked, then Sims may react multiple times if they re- enter the broadcaster's area of influence. If unchecked, then Sims will only react to the broadcaster once.

TunableTuple.name: on_pulse
TunableTuple.description: Sims and objects are constantly affected by this broadcaster while they are in its area of influence.

Tunable.name: cooldown_time
Tunable.description: The time interval between broadcaster pulses. Sims would not react to the broadcaster for at least this amount of time while in its area of influence.

Tunable.name: immediate
Tunable.description: If checked, this broadcaster will trigger a broadcaster update when added to the service. This adds a performance cost so please use this sparingly. This can be used for one-shot interactions that generate broadcasters because the update interval might be excluded in the interaction duration.

TunableList.name: route_events
TunableList.description: Specify any route events that are triggered when the Sim follows a path that has points within this broadcaster's constraints.

Tunable.description: A Route Event that is to be played when a Sim plans a route through this broadcaster.
